byline.contributor: Julie Hirschfeld Davis and Alan Rappeport contributed reporting from Washington, and Manny Fernandez from Houston.

abstract: Supreme Court rules, 5 to 3, against restrictive Texas abortion law, concluding that its strict requirements on abortion providers are medically unnecessary and unconstitutionally limit women's right to abortions; decision means similar requirements in other states are most likely also unconstitutional, and is sure to energize anti-abortion forces and make abortion central issue in 2016 presidential campaign.

headline.main: Supreme Court Strikes Down Texas Abortion Restrictions

snippet: Had the justices upheld the regulations, the number of abortion clinics in the state would have dropped to 10.
lead_paragraph: Had the justices upheld the regulations, the number of abortion clinics in the state would have dropped to 10.
